Title: Expectations surpassed!
Name: Prashast_Singh
actions:
69 out of 86 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
"Hindi viewers, please don't regret later on when it'll be playing on TV and internet." This is what I mentioned in my review of KGF Chapter 1 after I watched it in cinemas. And today, as I witnessed the second chapter of this epic action saga in cinemas as well, I found myself blown away by the gripping plot, gorgeous visuals, stunning action sequences and most importantly, Yash's screen presence as Rocky. I can safely proceed to state that my expectations were not only met, but also surpassed by this fine sequel.

KGF Chapter 2 expands the scale and story introduced to us in part 1 and ends up raising the bar higher. The makers were definitely quite confident making it, and it shows in every single frame. From beautifully picturizing the KGF (Kolar Gold Fields) to explosively choreographing the action sequences to elevating Rocky's character at multiple occasions, they have shown they knew what the viewers wanted, and delivered the promise product without any hassle. I was also glad to see heavy cheering and whistling throughout almost the entire duration, and some credit goes to the dialogue writer as well. The music was also good and delivered without interfering with the storytelling (though one song in the second half wasn't really necessary).

The biggest plus point of the film is its screenplay. From re-introducing our favorite characters and introducing new ones to building up conflicts and backing them with explosive action, KGF Chapter 2 has all the ingredients of a proper mass entertainer. Not a single scene where it feels dragged or overdone. Sure, it does feel long at times, but it never gets boring, and with several twists and turns, the story remains intriguing till the end.

One thing I'd definitely want to tell the viewers is to not simply get up and walk away once the credits start rolling. There is a mid-credits scene, and it's an important one. Other than that, this film should be on your watchlist if you like period action films. In the end, I just feel glad and kind of proud seeing a film I liked in 2018 going on to receive much bigger hype and viewer turnout with its second part in 2022.

Title: KGF - Chapter 2 is The Super-Duper Blockbuster Movie of 2022 !!!
Name: rahul000994
actions:
44 out of 55 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
KGF - Chapter 1, set the tone for a slick gangster franchise-high on style and details. The first part was all about establishing the intentions and power of Raja Krishnappa Bairya aka Rocky Bhai. The second part has managed to create hype with its promotional content that gives a peek into the film. Does the film manage to match the build-up? It does and provides a better sequel and also has a big surprise for fans in the end, too.

The film begins with Vijayendra Ingalagi, the son of Anand Ingalagi, taking over as the narrator. Rocky has won over the people of KGF and he is now in the process of dreaming bigger and treading more dangerous paths. In this process, he encounters Adheera, who is inspired by the Vikings and evokes visceral fear, who wants KGF back. Simultaneously, he also has to encounter the righteous Prime Minister Ramika Sen, who also wants Rocky taken down.

The story progresses at a brisk pace in a racy tale of Rocky's journey to the top. The film, like the first part, presents a dark, dreary world that is stylishly shot. While the first part took time to prove who the protagonist was and included more time to establish the same, this second part moves quicker and one gets to meet more characters. The conflicts and battles are more interesting this time.

This film gets to showcase the emotional side of Rocky too, with a love story and even some glimpses into his past life that fuelled his ambition. The love story doesn't take away too much from the tale either. One of the best shots in the film is the introduction of Adheera played by Sanjay Dutt. It is pure magic on screen and evokes whistles organically. Raveena Tandon as the Prime Minister also has a good track. The other interesting addition is Rao Ramesh as the CBI officer. Prakash Raj also makes for a good narrator, with his baritone adding an immersive experience.

The film belongs as much to filmmaker Prashanth Neel as it does to Yash. Both of them have managed to deliver a sequel that seems more immersive than the first part. Albeit, Prashanth has always maintained that the second part had the bigger chunk of his original story when they decided to break it into two parts.

For the audience who wants to watch a loaded action film with style, heavy-duty stunts, and dialogues, this one is simply made to order. KGF: Chapter 2 might not appeal to the seemingly woke audience, who would question consent or nitpick on commercial staples like violence. But for those who love such films, here's an essential spoiler, as there is a hint at a possible third chapter in the end credits, so wait until the end.

text:
Right through K. G. F: Chapter 2, I couldn't help but imagine what it must have been like for Prashant Neel to watch The Godfather for the first time. More than the whole film, I'd love to ask him someday about the impact its climax left him with as he watched it in what I imagine to be an old theatre, wherever he grew up. Like the iconic theatre scene in Cinema Paradiso, this moment must have been Prashanth's big life-altering moment, his metamorphosis where he not only discovered the magic of movies but also the concept of "mass" before it became a thing. Without sounding too dramatic, something must have clicked in him because there's no one here who thinks in intercuts like this man.

Read the full review on Film Companion.

Title: The perfect mass masala superstar vehicle!
Name: nidhunmoviebuff
actions:
36 out of 49 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
OMG. What did I just watch! KGF Chapter 2 is a blistering, adrenaline-pumping, high-stakes sequel to what was an era-defining part 1 that propelled not just Prashant Neel and superstar Yash but also the entire Kannada film industry, into national prominence. The team has clearly made the best use of the higher budget it received after the first film's success, keeping the emotional resonance from the original intact and building elaborate, well written and intelligently shot and edited mass elevation scenes that will keep you clamouring for more till the awe-inspiring climax.

We rejoin our hero, Rocky Bhai as he takes over control of the Kolar Gold Fields after having killed the demonic "Garuda" in the first film, only to have an entire can of worms open up as a consequence with everyone ranging from Garuda's vengeful uncle "Adheera" (Sanjay Dutt) to the Prime Minister of India "Ravika" (Raveena Tandon) training their sights on his lucrative fiefdom. Director Prashant Neel gets his casting choices spot on with both these Bollywood biggies bringing in their A-game as menacing antagonists that hold their own against Yash's sheer swag and star power.

The void left by legendary Kannada actor Anand Nat opting not to return to the franchise due to personal reasons was ably filled by National-award winner Prakash Raj, while the rest of the returning cast play their roles with flourish, especially Ayyappa P Sharma as "Vanaram", Harish Rai as "Khasim", Achyuth Kumar as "Guru Pandian" and Govinda Gowda as the cheeky "office assistant". Srinidhi Shetty is nondescript as Rocky Bhai's love interest "Reena", with their romance track bordering on an extreme case of Stockholm Syndrome, being the only hiccup in an otherwise flawless mass masala entertainer.

Prashant Neel's ability to smoothly intercut the main timeline with flashbacks to Rocky Bhai's childhood means that the mother character, played ably by Archana Jois, makes an even more emotionally endearing impact on Chapter 2, with the mother-son bond continuing to be the glue that holds together what would otherwise have been a shallow massy outing.

Prashant Neel has made creating innovative mass elevation sequences an art form and with a star of Yash's natural badassery and swagger as his foil, the auteur has clearly cut loose with the sheer scale and scope of his sets rising to earthshattering levels, without sacrificing on ingenuity and the ability to catch the audience by surprise. The intro sequences of our three primary characters, played by Yash, Dutt and Tandon are choreographed with pinpoint precision to evoke maximum mass impact and are custom-made to play to each performer's strengths. While Neel uses Dutt's eyes and hulky silhouette to portray his beastly and brutal nature, with Tandon, he resorts to using minimal hand and facial gestures to showcase the sheer unspoken power wielded by her character, inspired by India's Iron Lady, Indira Gandhi herself.

And what can I say about Yash that hasn't been already said? Irrepressible swag, a natural coyness and obnoxious body language mean he is a natural fit as the morally ambiguous gangster and it is this very nature that adds to the unpredictability of the KGF universe with the audience constantly on the ropes, unable to guess or comprehend what the crazy mafioso will do next. Music director Ravi Basrur carries on the same rich vein as in the first part, elevating each punch sequence with layers of feeling and goosebumps, switching over effortlessly from the massy highs of "Sulthana" to the emotionally wrought "Thannane".

"KGF Chapter 2" stands head and shoulders over other recent Indian blockbuster fan service mass vehicles like "Pushpa (2021)" and "RRR (2022)" because of the editing and staging prowess of its director, with seemingly unrelenting action and a narrative that constantly keeps you guessing and on a knife-edge. A mandatory theatre watch! Highly, highly recommended! And don't forget to catch the post-credits scene!

Title: In terms of Pure Charisma, there's nobody like Yash, he is something else!
Name: SoumikBanerjee25
actions:
7 out of 9 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
The people who fell in love with the first chapter, I can safely say that they are in for an absolute delight. It's bigger, better and more grand in the truest sense of the word! Prashant Neel knew what the fans wished for and he duly delivers. With electrifying Cinematography, phenomenal background score and a surplus of action set pieces, it's nothing but an Action Junky's dream come true.

Regardless, speaking of my personal opinion on it, I did enjoy my time in the theatres, and did take a strong liking to whatever this had in its offerings; However, I wasn't fully sold on it.

Halt the hate train and just let me clarify...

I have mainly two criticisms, one is about the forceful incorporation of romance (which was mostly counterproductive) and the other one is a somewhat loose portrayal of Sanjay Dutt as "Adheera". Just try to remember what Prashant Neel previously did with Ramachandra Raju as Garuda. That character, not only looked ferocious and frightening he also talked evil, acted evil, and the whole aura around him was appalling to say the very least.

Now when it comes to Adheera, the impression is quite distinct. Don't get me wrong, he still is efficient enough and Mr Dutt played the role remarkably well, it's just that his character appeared more like a murderous, bloodthirsty warrior (inspired by Viking traditions) than a vicious, vile adversary against our lead protagonist.

For Srinidhi Shetty (as Reena); My qualms are a little different. I would not put the entire blame on her, as she did whatever the director had made her do. It's her character, or the writing rather, that leaves much to be desired. On a side note, I admire what they did with Ramika Sen; she's fierce, desperate and very much to the point. Needless to say, Raveena Tandon did an incredible job as well.

Looking at how my review had gone so far, you guys might be having some doubts regarding my judgements, well, don't get any wrong ideas cause I wholeheartedly appreciate the film for what it is and what it represents. And the main reason for my fondness goes to Yash aka Rocky!

I'm telling you, this man is something else. I have seen lots of superstars over the years but none come remotely close to what Yash brings to the table. His magnetic personality, the specific way in which he delivers his lines, and the undeniable charisma that he possesses; it's truly one of a kind, unparalleled in every sense.

Title: Kannada Cinema in all its Glory
Name: sujanfaster
actions:
14 out of 21 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
The ambition of the movie KGF is kind of like its lead character Rocky Bhai which is to conquer whatever is possible. Chapter 1 not only made sure Kannada movie industry on the map, but also led to the start of filmmakers taking pan India releases seriously. This was just because of the sheer quality of dubbing, right partnerships and promotion efforts while releasing in other languages. Finally, when KGF Chapter 2 is hitting the screens 3.5 years after its predecessor the cinema lovers across India also across some parts of the world have embraced it with love. KGF is complex and detailed filmmaking at its best for a gangster action drama. Director Prashant Neel's attention to detail is what makes it stand out from the rest of action/drama movies. With only 3 films under his belt in the last 8 years, it looks like he has already established his brand of filmmaking.

While the first part showed us the rise of Rocky bhai after dethroning Garuda in KGF, the plot of the second part is slightly more complex and political. Chapter 2's narration is almost like a biopic of an actual gangster (or should I say monster :P). The movie keeps you hooked frame by frame and almost makes you feel a part of the world of KGF. Cinematography, art direction and the background score elevate almost every scene to a different level. Adheera's introduction scene involving his entry into Rocky's territory starts literally by "burning bridges". This is just a sample of many cleverly executed scenes throughout the movie.

The dark sepia kind of tone with barely any colourful visuals perfectly suits director's narrative. The action sequences have been executed and edited more like art and haven't gone unnecessarily over the top. One of the fight scenes which is barely relevant to the plot still makes for a great watch just because of the background narration and the camerawork. The dialogue writing continues to impress, and it is one of the best I have seen in Kannada cinema in my lifetime. The songs may seem like almost a continuation of part 1 music, but the visual treatment of them makes you hum and cheer along. There is a brilliant mini recreation of part 1 in the song 'Toofan' and it is probably one of the best example of Neel's genius execution.

The KGF franchise has focused a lot on each and individual characters. Irrespective of how big/small the role is almost each of them gets a narration and introduction of their own. This turns out to be both a blessing and a curse, especially in this movie. The character arc for some roles turns out to be slightly abrupt, but I guess it is the sacrifice director must make for the optimal running time. This does not affect Rocky Bhai's character and the evolution from Chapter 1 to Chapter 2 is handled seamlessly. Yash's dialogue delivery as Rocky will forever be a trademark of its own. Almost every line of Rocky bhai's character is a punch dialogue and Yash delivers them all in style without seeming to be jarring. He brings shades of Al Pacino from Scarface at times. Sanjay Dutt as Adheera has a great screen presence as an antagonist but somehow his character lacks a strong conflict with the lead and a detailed backstory to establish his purpose better. Srinidhi Shetty does get a longer screen time and she does more than a decent job with very few lines. Her character towards the end turns out to be a bit too mainstream and I believe that was planned by the director keeping a certain section of the audience in mind. Prashant Neel has very cleverly handled Raveena Tandon's dubbing and has not tried to force her lip sync in Kannada. This also serves the purpose of her being in Delhi as the Prime Minister. All other supporting characters contribute their bit to movie's elevating moments. Harish Rai as Chacha is a very well written old school supporting character and hats off to the director for creating a right mix of veteran and new age Kannada movie actors.

KGF Chapter 2 is more than just a mass entertainer. It is the perfect artistic execution of the story of a movie and credit has to be given to all its departments. It is an event to witness in one's lifetime and if you are a Kannadiga, you'd be walking out of the theatre beaming with pride.

Title: Definitely over the top, but can be excused!
Name: l-80790
actions:
9 out of 13 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
HONEST REVIEW FROM A NOT A FAN OF YASH!

Just like KGF 1, KGF 2 is also extremely over the top so if you were a fan of KGF before , then only choose this film. Just don't go watch KGF 2 just because of the hype and stuff, watch KGF 1 first..see if you liked it then go for 2nd part as this film caters mostly to young audience and die hard fans of masala films.

KGF 2 can be easily excused for its over the top nature solely because of some terrific performances and interesting story telling. It is exactly the same storytelling like KGF 1 but director Neel takes it one step above. It is this interesting storytelling that held my attention in part 1 and even now in part 2.

The BGM is just earthquake inducing ..it's extremely loud but it's so electrifying that it elevates any scene where Yash would be present. I personally enjoyed the BGM. Dialogues are again those typical chest thumping ones from what you expect from South India. But they are hard hitting and good to hear. Especially from Yash's mother.

Filled with tons of whistle/clap worthy scenes be it Yash or Sanju baba both have got some terrific dialogues that induce whistles.

Performances. Everyone has done a fantastic job be it the lead or the side actors .

Cinematography and setting of this film is just top class. Definitely you can feel the green screen background at places but whats in front of that green screen is just mesmerizing. Rustic and raw looking . The mines are so well set that grayish tone and everything gives that rustic look. Highly impressed.

Climax battle is a treat. All hell break loose. That final battle felt like I was watching some battle from some kingdom film where two kings from two kingdoms are fighting. Absolute treat for masala lovers. Fires coming out as Adheera and Rocky proceed to clash is just extraordinary to watch. Full value for money scene.

Negatives - a section no 10/10 reviewer would tell you but I'll highlight them. 1. Stretched ending 2. Some hilarious fight sequences. I am not a die hard fan of any south film so when I see such action, it definitely looks super exciting but at the same time definitely makes me laugh at least once. 3. An absolute not needed romantic song in the 2nd half that Unnecessarily increases the length of the film further which already is stretched at the end. 4. In 1st half there is a car chase sequence (that imo looked exactly like the one from the climax of Race 3 lol) . The way it is shot, in start-stop manner , didnt like it. Would have enjoyed a full sequence rather than that start-stop fashion . Also, wait, wait. There is a scene at the very last related to Rocky it looked exactly inspired from James Bond : no time to die ending sequence.

Overall, if you are a die hard masala film fan or even if you loved KGF 1, then you cannot miss KGF 2. You pay 200rs or 1700rs for the most expensive cinema, you will feel totally satisfied.

PS - I don't glorify/ celebrate films like these.

Title: NOT ROLLERCOASTER BUT A MONSTER 👹 COASTER
Name: ronaldo_matrix
actions:
6 out of 10 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Written and directed by Prasanth Neel who made people anxious and crazy about his love for the character of Rocky from KGF 1 finally arrives in theatres after a long gap of almost 3 and a half years. Well arrival is such an understatement for this movie, it shreds the box office like anything you have previously seen on a big screen. I have never seen fans so anxious and crazy about a movie since Avengers finale and I have got to tell you that this is the most overwhelming movie experience I have had of any Indian Movie in cinemas ever period. People were literally shouting and cheering even before the Big title showed on the screen and it definitely marks the greatest entrance of a character in a movie. Not to mention I went to the last show possible in the theatre near me and I wasn't expecting it to be houseful at midnight but God am I glad to be wrong.

What I really liked about this movie over RRR recently is the inclusion of Bollywood actors ( Sanju Baba and Raveena Tandon) in pivotal roles which I felt were shoehorned in the RRR Movie but are of paramount importance here and leave their mark in style.

The charm and magnetic presence of rocking star Yash is undeniable and the swag 😎 with He carries this character can't be replaced with anyone else helming this iconic role.

I was amazed to see how they pulled of such visuals and set pieces with a budget of mere 100 crore (although you do see some noticable VFX or cuts in production here and now).

The best thing I really appreciate about this movie is the fact that it is a sequel and a quintessential in that regard. It's been so long since I have seen a sequel that completely overshadows its predecessor with such a novelty and surpasses all the expectations. While Raving about this I might add this this one is not without it's setbacks (although minor) which do not bring down movie much but sure could be enhanced in the 3rd installment with some addition to the budget constraints.

The editing still feels a bit choppy but not as jarring to look at when compared to it's predecessor where it was hard to comprehend what's going on the screen no matter how hard you try. The BGM here is loud again ( not for the faint hearted) but appropriate to the story and only adds to the screenplay. The romantic angle feels forced and could have been avoided but I do understand that this one is Emotion centric at core so they had to include that and it does pay off in the end when the showdown between the two nutheads begin.

Well I got in it for the story telling perspective and not for the action sequences but I do want to confess that some action sequences are so well choreographed that you will be left in awe especially the Kashnikov scene (you will understand when it comes). The story here is less Messier and more linear than the first one makes the backbone of this monstercoaster of a ride.

Do watch in theatres with biggest crowd possible (you will thank me later).

Magnum Opus of Kannada movie Industry indeed.

VERDICT: 4.5/5.

Title: Chapter 1 was a masterpiece. This one is Bad.
Name: zeeshanabid
actions:
13 out of 38 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
I normally don't write Spoiler reviews. But it's truly frustrating that so many people are rating this movie 10/10. While the movie doesn't deserve higher than an average of 6.

K. G. F. Chapter 1 was one of the best movies of Indian Cinema. It had a strong script that built the character of Rocky as well as utilized him smartly. Direction was artistic. Scenes of several different times and locations were showed in continuous slides with dialogues from different people intermingled to deliver the message in a very exotic way. Instead of telling the story linear and chronologically, it had done that dynamically with scenes at places that made those exciting as well as fun to watch. That was indeed 10/10. I've watched it 7 times.

This second part, however, seems poor imitation of its own first part. Immensely huge population is rating it high because of the hype created and the wait for two additional years for this movie. And for that they're deeply feeling the Charisma of Rocky, which the movie has delivered well. But the truth is, many things that made the first chapter great are entirely missing here. Director have failed to use the same artistic style appropriately, and in fact, most of the movie is told chronologically. Not that it's a bad thing, because most movies have chronological story-telling. But due to this the story of this second chapter became more important. And sadly, the script of this chapter is extremely poor. Numerous actions and character reactions felt absurd and unrealistic. Several character motivations were destroyed by extended details.

Rocky's romance chemistry is also made extremely weaker, even though lot more time is spent on this compared to the first chapter. In previous chapter it was established that Reena had already fallen in love with Rocky. And all Rocky needed to do is ask her to go with him, as she could have become a target for hurting Rocky. Hence, her life could be in danger outside KGF. She would surely not have denied, and in fact, would have went with him happily. Doing that would have also brought him Rajendar Desai as his alliance, which would have helped him greatly. But what he did here is kidnap Reena and keep her in KGF forcefully, which resulted in her loss of her love and respect for him. What most people don't understand, the positive feelings she later felt could be due to Stockholm Syndrome, which many victims of Kidnapping suffer with. Hence, whatever romance build later showed that resulted in her pregnancy was to out of affection for him but because of her desire to be loved by her Kidnapper.

All the villains in the movie are used poorly. Adheera's character is given scary getup and personality. But his actions do not scare as much as Garoda did in first part. He's told to be extremely cruel and heartless and such. And what he does in the best opportunity to kill Rocky? He wastes that opportunity himself by sending Rocky. And the reason? He wants the people to see their beloved to die in their hands. Same affect could have been achieved in a far better way, and with zero risks involved if he would have send them his dead body. Those twenty thousand people were showed to be extremely scared of Adheera already. Watching Rocky's dead boy would have destroyed their morale completely. They would have surrendered as soon as Adheera's army would have landed there. So, the actual reason Adheera didn't kill Rocky was because the script didn't want Rocky to die at the moment, and the script writers could not come up with a better idea of keeping Rocky alive.

Ramika's character was wasted in a big way. Although she delivered some very good few punch-line dialogues in the movie, she was eventually showed as an idiot politician and PM of India. Why the hell would she want to bomb the entire KGF? She had sent the Indian army there. She could have brought control over those fields and continued mining gold for the government. It is showed that her intentions were to avoid releasing details of the company delivering money to everyone in her surrounding, including her own party's fund. But surely this could have been done in a lot smarter way compared to bombing and destroying a land full of gold. Although the movie suggest Rocky had already mined all (or most of) gold from those lands, she didn't know this. Besides, this could be wrong prediction as well. There could be more gold in that land. And after bombing that entire zone, what she did? She left he land completely, instead of working out if there was any gold somewhere.

In Chapter 1 there were several characters who brought some dramatic impact. There was a mad man who talked rubbish and told stories, but those stories had connections to the heroism of Rocky. There were also two elderly men who worked as leaders/elders/supervisors of the slaves of KGF. There were also other characters from the slaves, like the ones who died for saving Rocky. Presence of these characters connected the viewers with the slaves of KGF. In chapter 2, all these characters removed. A combo of mother and son was brought forth to bring some dramatic impact, but that combo failed to bring real emotions into the story, and only succeeded in delivering some unrealistic but dramatic dialogues.

Besides the main characters, almost all other characters were useless or replaceable in the story of second chapter. Kamal, Rajendra Desai, Virat (and his companion, which isn't clear what happened to him), were wasted, even though they were built character (in Chapter 1) and their deaths could have brought forth lot better drama into the story. Guru Pandian and Andrews were doing something, but not showing properly what they were doing in relations to Rocky and his operations destroyed their impact their betrayals could have impacted the viewer. It was also unclear how much Inayat Khalil was connected with Rocky's operations, for which his angry reaction later on also delivered no feeling at all. The story kept going with numerous things unclear, even about what exactly Adheera was doing while recovering. Hence, the story became entirely unimportant. And be frank, the directors and writers seems to have done it intentionally. They wanted to keep their focus completely on Rocky's charisma and dialogue deliveries. Which, in my view, could have also be done by keeping proper delivery of the story (as the first chapter did.)

Let's come to another issue with the script. Guru Pandian's hidden actions were supposed to deliver a twisting climax surprise. As I said earlier, the unfolding of this twist failed to deliver the shocking impact this should have delivered because we were not showed his connection and attachment to Rocky and his business properly. But it also failed because several of the things happened were entirely unclear. Most importantly the no-confidence motion drama, and then the election of Ramika Sen, like how exactly DYSS later failed and then Ramika Sen then came to power. Also, the drama of that secret passage from which Rocky realized that behind everything there was Guru Pandian. And if we look closely, several of Pandian's actions seemed idiocy. He had staged the attack on Garuda for which Adheera was framed, and informed Adheera of Garuda's attack priorly. Now, why exactly he did that? To take control over KGF? How? When he ignited a war between Garuda and Adheera, it was obvious that one of them would have won. And whoever won would then have control of KGF, not him. Alright, he might have plans to kill the other by other means. But in that case wasn't it better to have let Adheera get killed by Garuda and then kill Garuda by using an assassin (Rocky in this case)? Why save Adheera then by informing him of Garuda's plan of killing him?

Now let's come to the ending. In my eyes this is the worst possible ending the writers should have come up with. Ok, KGF was destroyed. So what? Rocky wanted to become the richest man on earth to fulfill his promise to his dying mother. Technically, he had no attachment to the land of KGF. He was only interested in the gold underneath the lands. And he had already grabbed most or all of it. Now he is on a ship full of that gold. He probably has more gold than most governments in the world. What should be his action now? There are many things he can actually do. He can go to a poor country and make a deal with them, offering some or half of his gold in exchange of his placement in that country's government system. He can also purchase several islands, hire an impressive mercenary army, and live like a King for the rest of his life, and die at the age of 80 as the richest man on earth. But what he does here? He goes directly to Indian Navy, and also tells them he's coming to them, so that they kill him. Why is in so much hurry to die in presence of his gold? Probably he doesn't have confidence on himself that he would be able to keep his gold for the rest of his life. And he doesn't want to die without his gold. Duh!

Only reason I'm even giving this chapter 3 stars instead of 1 is because Rocky's charisma delivered good impact at several places in the movie, which were fun to watch, along with some creative dialogues from him as well as Ramika Sen. But overall it is the biggest opportunity lost in the History of Indian Cinema. This movie surely had the potential of breaking all the records ever. It could have achieved even bigger feats compared to Baahubali Conclusion. Maybe this chapter would still do good business, because Indian's are more diverted towards brainless charisma type movies, rather than realism of the stories. But honestly, anyone who watch the movies and can see through the untold parts of the movie would feel the same frustration I did while watching this chapter.

Title: KGF 2 (and KGF-1 too) will forever be known as emotions
Name: Grey_rainbow
actions:
3 out of 6 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
I am writing this after my second viewing and have to say I loved KGF-2 more the second time. And I already have an urge to watch it one more time very soon. The feeling you get after watching this movie cannot be evoked just by the story, script, bgm, epic scale, spectacle, gorgeous cinematography, humor, actors, or emotional scenes. They all are necessary, but more importantly they also have to blend well. KGF-2 blends them all so well that it lingers around for a long time with you. The impact is so deep that you can't watch any other movie for a few days. And that's what compels you to watch KGF-2 again and again, until you overdo it.

That's my review, that's my way of saying that KGF-2 is not a movie, but an emotion, just like KGF-1.

Some may not connect to KGFs at emotional level. I feel bad for them because then KGFs would look to them like a string of flashy/humorous/emotional scenes in an epic backdrop involving a complex war for the throne and gold. They would find it to be a good movie (based on technical aspects, story, and other parameters), but not a great movie and definitely can't understand those of us who call it an emotion.

                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.

text:
There's immense hype for the movie. Some might get disappointed and some might be overwhelmingly happy. Personally, I loved the movie a lot.

There's not much scope for the story, much like the Chapter 1. But the movie does the justice to the action sequences, buildup to the heroes, villains and other characters.

Yash as Rocky bhai nailed it yet again. Other characters were superb too. Sanjay Dutt, Raveena Tandon, Sreenidhi Shetty, Achyuth Kumar, Prakash Raj and every other character were very good.

However, there are two slightly underwhelming aspects. While the background music was very good, the songs weren't upto the expectations. While the hero faces a lot of challenges, it also becomes pretty obvious through the motion of the movie that the hero would be nearly unbeatable. The movie still surprises the audience with its unexpected twists.

Overall, it's a very good movie. My suggestion would be not to have any expectations. It's indeed above expectations due to the scale and action.

And, one shouldn't definitely miss the post-credits scene.

Title: Near hit !!
Name: shashankds-89360
actions:
1 out of 1 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Credit to Prashanth Neel and Vijay Kirgandur for dreaming so big and executing such a massive dream; nearly every frame has multiple characters who never looked crowded or forced in ;

It's a very difficult movie to make and they have made it well.

The cinematography is top notch ; this man will go places

Yash lights up the screen ; his dialogues feel out of place every now and then-it dilutes the intensity especially his Intro scene :( but his swag and style make up for whatever rubbish lines he says sometimes)

Srinidhi Shetty deserved much meatier role for her commitment to the movie

Sanjay Dutt screams a bit more than necessary

Raveena Tandon is a find and she nails it

Greatest loss in the movie- Anant nag is sorely missed - whatever reason may be, Prakash Rai's substitution does not do justice to the movie: ANANT Ingalagi's narration lifted the movie; you can't help but imagine Anant nag in place of Prakash Rai every time he narrates and end up feeling disappointed .

Malavika gets monotonous and repetitive after sometime .

Towards the end I stopped rooting for the mother- I felt she was eventually responsible for her son becoming a criminal - to become rich at every expense

Having said so many negatives, still I vouch for the entire team's commitment to Make such a brave attempt; you need a large heart to do such a movie- I saw and felt similar efforts in Avane Srimannarayana and am glad this movie is doing well - Happy days for kannada cinema

Please watch the movie inspite of all its flaws ( I am nit picking like a purist ); I enjoyed it but could not find a character I wanted to root for like KGF chapter 1.

Title: GREAT EXPERIENCE
Name: murlimohanrao
actions:
1 out of 2 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Hailing from Bangalore, I always wondered why Kannada movies with a rich heritage never struck gold at the Indian box office. It was far more subdued than other South Indian film industries. KGF 1 and now KGF 2 have changed all that. It is therefore a matter of immense pride for me personally to see Kannada movies doing so well.

I watched the movie at the global premiere in UAE ... the 1150pm show, even though the next day was a working day. But, not once did I regret going to a movie at such an inappropriate time. The movie was all I expected and much more. It had a great storyline that remained true to the central theme of Rocky having a motive. Every action emanates from that and which is exactly why you constantly empathize with his character, even though his villainy was obnoxious at times. That is the strength of the writing, as you viewed the character just like the way the director aspired. This for me was the biggest strength of the movie.

The movie continues from where KGF1 left. All the aspirers to throne of Narachi are stunned into silence when Rocky replaces Garuda at the helm of affairs. So, to get him down, they connect with Adhira, the uncle of Garuda. The fight then is between Adhira and Rocky. You see many points where it looks like Rocky is going down to Adhira but he always has a plan up his sleeve. The culmination of that fight forms the crux of the movie.

Prashant Neel has done an amazing job with his writing and direction. Every frame looks like a masterpiece and the dark muted tones makes the movie a visual delight. Some of the frames are simply out of this world. The casting is picture perfect including Adhira, Ramika and others. It seems they selected themselves for this role. I would recommend this movie to every cinema lover.

The climax is a killer and after the Kattappa Bahubali saga, this is indeed a break point to cherish. I hope the makers of KGF have a plan up their sleeve.

Title: Unbelievably Marvellous ! Too Exquisite to Exist !
Name: omkarnaik-12673
actions:
1 out of 2 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
This movie will make you feel emotions that you have never felt in your entire life, once out of the movie theatre you will be left with no words to even describe the larger-than-life experience you just had. The fast and crisp storytelling and an onslaught of Mind-blowing dialogues will blow your mind away.

Chapter 2 is totally surreal and unbelievably magnificent in its entirety. The cinematography of this film is something that will be talked about for years and act as a reference for the upcoming generation of aspiring filmmakers. The BGM is very energetic and will keep you hooked to the screen for the entire time

The core emotion of the film which is the bond between the MOTHER and SON is beautifully blended with the action-packed storyline and it never feels out of place or unnecessary and has a great impact on the decisions taken by the main character ROCKY.

The first half of the film focuses on Rocky and the developments he witnessed in his life after the conclusion of chapter 1 and the relationship that he builds with the people of KGF. The song 'TOOFAN' will surely give you goosebumps and it also very smartly retells the events which unfold in the FIRST Chapter.

The second half is full of twists and turns and will keep you on the edge of your seats.

AND the CLIMAX of this film is VISUALLY STUNNING and of PEAK PERFECTION.

The entire cast including YASH, SANJAY DUTT, SRINIDHI SHETTY, and others did a fabulous job and gave full justice to their characters but among them all, RAVEENA TANDON with limited screentime gave her career-best performance and stood out in the character of RAMIKA SEN. She was an equal match for ROCKY as the villain.

DON'T THINK TOO MUCH

Just go and watch this MASTERPIECE

IT IS WORTH YOUR TIME AND MONEY.

Title: What's more overrated than this movie ? Nothing.
Name: YourBossHere-00
actions:
1 out of 3 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Finally decided to watch the second part after all the hype even after finding first part to be just average. Thought the director might have actually improved but ohh no i was so wrong it's worse now.

The movie starts with the entry of our Rocking Star Yash with a BGM and they Forgotted to off that BGM throught the film. BGM plays on throughout the whole movie yeah it's good but after one points it's just unbearable and can cause headache even during normal talking scenes there is a BGM. Then the film proceeds to have 20 more entry scenes of Yash till the end of the movie. Everyone comes praises Rocky then disappear oh gosh. The second half bores you in place of being entertaining specially during romantic scenes which you seriously don't care about. The romance seems very forced just to make Rocky Bhai furious enough to kill Adheera.

The action sequences are just as poorly edited as the first part the most awkward is the car chase scene where it continuously blacks out for no reason dude show it clearly it's a action movie after all. The action in other parts is also medicore and again fast paced with many cuts. The supporting actors are there just for the sake of it. Sanjay Dutt is wasted with very minimum screen time and no character depth at all you know already he would get defeated by Rocky Bhai easily. Raveena is decent in her role but again not much importance given to her . Plus the movie is filled with many absurd scenes which don't make any sense.

Overall the second part is even worse than first and only cinematography can't save a bad film infact i founded the first part to have better colours and better frames than this. How are people calling this mess a masterpiece is beyond my understanding. It's just too much to take. Chapter 3 is also coming which I'm not even tiny bit interested about after this movie's experience.

Title: G. F.O. A.T
Name: kothapallibalaganesh
actions:
1 out of 4 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Art is for the Humans, by the Humans Period!

Not watching this mighty film on big screen is equivalent to seeing Monalisa in real life. She's only an art if she's on canvas. If not, she just a normal looking human being like everyone.

Similarly this brutally crude, appealingly exhilarating, superabundant entertainer can only be savored on Big Screen.

Cinema is where the 24 commanding art forms come together into an invincibly aggregated energy and we as Humans are bound to behold the beauty: The KGF Chapter 2.

We can't teach a monkey to ponder & dissect the facets of a multilayered piece of art even if we dedicate our whole lives in training it. Of all things bestowed on the so-called "supremely heavenly entities" Human Beings, the ability to cognize, analyze & comprehend an art form is the apex of all. Imbibing art, appreciating the art form glorifies the Human existence and maintains the balance between sanity & insanity of Life.

KGF Chapter 2 is barely an integral chapter in the history of Indian Cinema. It's a frickin' textbook on commercial condiments of art-imbuing Cinema. It's something bigger than you, me, and us and above us.

It's the redemption of endangering big screen phenomenon called CINEMA. This is CINEMA. It's inspiring, loud, taut, larger-than-life, rooted, astonishing, wild, inspiring & joyous.

I am completely steeped in the notion that the maker Prashant Neel who throttled this carnival is an alien and until he himself persuades me into believing he's not I am going to firmly stick to that assertion.

If you are a human and resist watching films like this you are not worth being a HUMAN. I'm sorry! But this is how it is. Cinema is not just an entertainer. CINEMA is art. Cinema is giving Life. Cinema is eternal, Cinema is responsibility, and Cinema is an experience with no replacement.

Cinema is larger than life. Beyond! Period. If you say otherwise fight & win me (that's impossible) This is not a review. It's a thank you note to the Cinema makers, of the cinema KGF, & by the Cinema admirer.


Bala (ScreenWriter)

Title: What does not kill you makes you a bigger achiever .
Name: ridi-arahan
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
What worked: One of the challenges while making the movie to make the viewers relate and convince them that the story is engaging. This movie is a winner for that matter. The movie is bigger, better and interesting, and even more engaging that the first chapter. The lead characters are commendable in their role. Sanjay Dhatt and Raveena were well introduced in their roles, added the needed spice and interest in the movie. It's amazing that a movie with this budget could hold the scale and execution in such a believable and engaging story. The narrative is well written , characters well acted, well edited, scored, mixed and produced. The movie with the budget could pull a production and execution makes a case study for the film makers as to how to execute and narrate the story. And for that matter director deserves the praise for keeping all the departments well balanced in their respective roles as a film makers. I am sure the film makers across are watching the movie with an awe and an opportunity to research how to make a movie with the scale, execution, acting and overall making of the movie. We have been hearing about a young and bright editor of the movie . I am sure everyone has an eye on him after this movie. The movie excites and eagers us for the next chapter of the great combo of Yash and Prashant's next venture, and we can say the movie is a benchmark and path breaker for the Indian movie industry to learn what can be achieved with the right vision and execution as the movie has rare dull moments but lots of punchlines and treats that keeps the jaws dropping for most parts of the movie What did not work: Very few scenes come to my head as what can and needs to be changed in this movie, making it better than the first chapter. Maybe the love song could have been shortened like other songs but hey who am I to say since the movie works overall for the most part which is quiet rare. So, even with plot holes, if any, movie works big time for the viewers to enjoy the ride.

Final verdict: highly recommended.

Title: A massive improvement over it's predecessor but still jarring & loud
Name: tkmce2008
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
My ears are still ringing after sitting through 168 minutes of extremely loud & jarring background score. But I must admit the sequel to the ultra-stylish KGF is far better than its predecessor. And we all how bad sequels usually turn out to be. To be honest, I didn't like the first movie even one bit. But Chapter 2, I didn't mind sitting through.

Chapter 2 picks up right after the events of Chapter 1. Rocky is now the undisputed king of KGF. But this position comes with its share of enemies and that include the Viking inspired, Adheera (Sanjay Dutt); Prime Minister, Ramika Sen (Raveena Tandon) among others.

KGF has its downsides. First and foremost is the jarring BGM, which literally numbs you for a while post-movie. Then comes the poor shooting skills: despite all the arms training, Rocky's men cannot hit a target. Adheera is standing front and centre; all his men get shot but Adheera gets shot once on his shoulder (a beautifully shot scene nevertheless). Rocky also sets up the biggest fan for his lady love - using helicopter blades.

But Chapter 2 is better in terms of its pacing. After all the setup done in the first, the sequel makes more sense. The stakes are higher, the action set pieces are more extravagant. The 19-year old editor, Ujwal Kulkarni does a very good job. Rocking Star, Yash is as flamboyant as ever. Raveena R Tandon & Sanjay Dutt are good. Prakash Raj replaces Anant Nag as the narrator (maybe they wanted a bigger star in this role). Female lead Srinidhi Shetty doesn't have much to do & her Stockholm Syndrome track doesn't bode too well.

Chapter 2 may cause irreversible damage to your ear drums but it is definitely a step up from the first. The final sequence on the ship seemed a bit anticlimactic and the announcement of Chapter 3 was totally unnecessary (better if they end on a high) but go for it if you love mass-y films. Rocking Star Yash's 8 years of hardwork and beard maintenance has paid off.

P. S. Find a theatre that is running the Kannada (original version) with Subtitles. Watching it in another language won't give you the full experience.

Title: Disappointed by the story but cinematography was great
Name: andreashoffwrites
actions:
1 out of 2 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
I was thinking that I would rate this movie 10/10 but after watching it, I was disappointed by the story. In my view, KGF Chapter 2 could not meet my expectations which was set high by KGF Chapter 1.

The Chapter 1 was filled with too much stories compacted in short period of time. It had got war, power, politics, diplomacy, emotions and everything else to make a movie great. But the Chapter 2 is unable to include everything in a balanced way. No doubt that there are great fight scenes with some rare cinematography ever witnessed in indian cinema. But story wise, it is too weak.

The character development isn't also in par with KGF Chapter 1. The portrayal of villainous characters are so weak that they only seem strong in their getup and armor. There is no diplomatic play between the characters. Sanjay Dutt as Adheera looks dangerous but the movie portrayed him in a weak way. There's no mind game. They just fight and and the only stronger wins. Other villains like Rajendar Desai, Shetty and Andrew who were portrayed great in Chapter 1 died of nothing. Also Adheera isn't someone who was shown to be like a diplomatic and strong character. Disappointed.

This movie is great if you are a fan of Yash and someone who likes fights, guns, slow motions, styles and cinematography. But other than that everything seems forced inside a movie to grab the attention of the audience (which failed in my case). The movie could have been great and better that Chapter 1.

Maybe the writer was unable to discern what made people like KGF Chapter 1. I will not go the theatre to watch the Chapter 3 with such weak story.

Title: Average at best, this film does the style way better than the substance
Name: maila-81326
actions:
0 out of 1 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text: KGF Chapter II will remain one of the most technically sound films made in India. Be it the expansive set design or the brilliant camerawork or even those lavish suits that Rocky wears, or the makeup on Adheera, KGF's technical department deserves all praise for making a grand contribution to this magnum opus BUT it is the story and overdose of machismo that makes a dent in the experience and leaves an average aftertaste. It might have the so-called spices that makes up a summer blockbuster but the screenplay is quite immaterial, hardly written with thought and care, and even to a point predictable. And Raveena Tandon does the finest in the acting department while the others only scream and yell - if only that could be called acting?! Yash does fine in getting the commanding presence required of his messiah plus gangster plus monster image in Rocky but his style and panache does get in the way of actual emoting. Also dubbing in Hindi could have been better.

actions:

                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.

text:
One of the better sequel or chapter 2 after Drishyam.

Toughest part for any director is continuing a same story in second chapter. When expectations are high they need to deliver a movie with strong story lineup... KGF2 has almost succeeded and gave a perfect sequel. I watched KGF1... for the first half i got bored but story opened up after 2nd half but in KGF2 story took pace in first half but lagged in second half. Overall a good movie... a hero oriented mass movie. I like the way of narration & story connecting to the sequence. Prashant Neel has a unique way of story telling hatsoff to his direction and Yash acting is fabulous, he carries an attitude look n style throughout the movie. Cinematography is awesome BGM looks overloaded sometimes it overlaps & irritating but editing was really bad compared to KGF1 fight & chasing scenes were worstly edited. All characters in the movie were up to the mark but Sanjay Dutt was literally unwanted to this movie Adheera character could have been done by some other actors from south who is famous for villain character like Jagapathi Babu or any other actor. Sanjay Dutt couldn't connect to the story, just his looks n style were good as a villain.

Go without any expectation... you will definitely like the movie.

Don't miss the twist in the end & initial narration of Prakash Raj its interconnected. Thank you 😊

text:
KGF2 - One should accept that if there could be a movie which can have a mass opening in par with a Bahubali, a RRR and many other it can only be KGF2. Flabbergasted by the kind of reception this movie had from the very beginning title card . It was indeed Larger than life. It took me 3.5 years to watch KGF 1 and that was a huge miss but this time I ensured not to make the same mistake and I did KGF2 in about 48hrs of release and I feel superbly happy . I repeat , the directors vision, control on the story and the screenplay, everything was at its best . Ravi Basrur, never heard before KGF and can never forget post either, brilliant music may it be songs or BGM. His contribution brought in so much life to the movie . Bhuvan Gowdaf for excellent cinematography, it was a different and amazing world altogether. And there was this whole load of actors including Sanjay Dutt, Raveena , Prakashraj, Srinidhi , Easwari Rao weaving this wonderful movie with a solid needle called Yash . Undoubtedly he pulls out his life's finest performance here and without missing even a inch he perfectly fits to the character . He's Super Smart and Sema Fit . I bet , none but him could have done this role any better . Salam Rocky Bhai. This is not just a movie but an experience. Loved every bit of it . Huge respect to director Prashanth Neel , words can't just say the kind of work he has put in . Class apart . I would say, The real BEAST of this season is ROCKY. Overall KGF, King of Great Films.

Note : Dont miss the scenes post credits at end of movie.

Title: Average movie ! Chapter 2 is < Chapeter 1
Name: nishantsharma-27542
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
KGF chapter 2 is final chapter of KGF saga. KGF both movies are no doubt best action movies in indian cinema with list of bahubali and RRR, but Prashant neel need to learn from rajamauli on how to conclude a movie. It appears Director is under a lot of pressure of expectation. A story must make it forward naturally but here it has forced to reach a end and to cover all character. Although this movie has already made a history. I have analysed this movie on different aspects.

1. Story: Chapter 2 is full of loopholes and forced narration. Although this story has a connection to common man but it not truely explain why a mother want his son to become most powerful man on earth but not tell any ethics ?..He just want to be powerful with no ethics and he is hero of the movie.

2. Direction: Very confused and reaching nowhere till end occur in a forced way. Many scenes are appeared without logic and this shows director is very confused with respect to expectation from first part.(7/10)

3. Acting: All actors have done justice to their roles but this film does not provide character justification and importance, such as Adheera. Director should give more depth to these characters but he misses.(7/10)

4. Action: Full on best part of movie(10/10).

5. Music & Background score: Songs are average and not good. Basrur disappoint this time. Songs from first part are better.(5/10)

Although background score is good. (9/10)

6. Editing: Could be more better and it is not smooth as chapter 1. (6/10)

Hence overall rating is 7/10 and chapter 2 is disappoinment w.r.t first chapter. Still it is shining star of kanada and indian film industry.

KGF2 GARGANTUAN BLOCKBUSTERS

Backed by solid emotions KGF Chapter2 goes all guns blazing with SPLENDID elevation scenes - world class visuals - wicked action scenes & act of a lifetime by Yash.

Prashanth Neel excels himself- Made one of the best sequel ever.

Yash emerges BIGGEST PAN INDIA SUPERSTAR WITH KGF Chapter2 .. His swag, intensity - wit- dialogue delivery & personality is UNPARALLELED in the film.. He is just MAGIC AS ROCKY BHAI..

Title: He is the BIGGEST criminal, he is the BIGGEST business man, this is the BIGGEST national issue!
Name: DhanuRated
actions:
0 out of 1 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
K. G. F: Chapter 2 was directed by Prashanth Neel and stars once again Yash as Rocky Bhai, the new kingpin of Kolar Gold Fields (also known as K. G. F.). Srinidhi Shetty, Archana Jois, Malavika Avinash, Ayyappa P. Sharma, Harish Rai and Dinesh Mangaluru reprise their roles from the first chapter, while Sanjay Dutt, Raveena Tandon, Saran Sakthi, Eswari Rao and Prakash Raj are the new cast members in this sequel. Chapter 2 is definitely a step-up, compared to the last installment. It's bigger and better, and the production value and action sequences have vastly improved. K. G. F: Chapter 2 is, without a doubt, a commercial film, but the difference between this movie and other Indian commercial films is that the movie relies heavily on the script. The film is 2 hours and 48 minutes long, and it doesn't waste any single frame during the entire runtime. There isn't one unnecessary scene that feels it doesn't belong in the script. Kudos to the producer, Vijay Kiragandur for understanding and sharing Prashanth Neal's vision, for appreciating this bold script and for letting Neel execute the film exactly how he wanted.

Bhuvan Gowda's cinematography is probably the best one I've seen in the past few years, when it comes to Indian cinema. It's evident that the crew has invested a lot in production values and set designs by just looking at the cinematography and see how detailed every frame is implemented. Every single frame is jaw-dropping and astoundingly gorgeous, and the visual effects are undoubtedly on point. Ujwal Kulkarni also deserves to be praised for editing the film as smoothly as possible and for keeping the movie thrilling and engaging from start to end. The amazing score and soundtrack by Ravi Basrur elevates the movie to a whole another level. It captures the emotions the characters go through, creates tension and increases the excitement level beautifully. The action sequences handled by Anbariv are astonishing and beyond what you could've ever imagined. It's also worth to mention that the action sequences rely heavily on practical effects, and the fact that they are in the same range as Hollywood films, such as Fast & Furious, Die Hard and Mad Max: Fury Road is refreshing to watch.

All the cast members have delivered powerhouse performances. Yash proves once again that he is the man of the show. His dialogue delivery and the way he perform the fight choreography are magnificent. Like I mentioned in my previous reviews, it's very important that the antagonist is equally as strong as the protagonist both mentally and physically to keep the film engaging. The way Prashanth Neel has structured and developed the character Adheera is excellent. Sanjay Dutt was absolutely the perfect choice for this role, and he knocked it out of the park with style. Raveena Tandon, Eswari Rao and Prakash Raj were also brilliant in their respective roles as Prime Minister Ramika Sen, Farman's mother and Vijayendra Ingalagi. Archana Jois, who portrayed Rocky's mother, Shanthamma, may have very little screen time compared to the rest of the cast, but she has surely delivered a phenomenal performance. Srinidhi Shetty, who portrayed Rocky's love interest, Reena Desai, definitely has a lot more to do in this film, compared to Chapter 1, and she has also delivered a neat performance.

Overall, K. G. F: Chapter 2 can easily be considered as one of the best action films India has ever produced, mainly for its technical finesse, strong dialogues, exceptional cinematography and brilliant performances. Don't miss it in the theaters.

Title: Monster entertainment from a Monster
Name: anandsagarsap
actions:
1 out of 1 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
What a movie!! Feast to eyes! Bgm and cinematography was better than part 1. Movie was finished in 90 crores but RRR budget was 500 crore! I watched both movies, trust me movie setup is very grand and realistic in KGF 2. I don't blame RRR, their setup were great, but in budget Of 90cr this movie is a gem!

There is no much chemistry shown between male and female lead roles, but I assume that was the aim of the movie, it was more of gangster movie than romantic entertainer!

Coming to dialogues! This was best I enjoyed, every dialogue was written carefully, and well executed!

Negative role by Sanju Baba, he did his best! The cruelty was well portrayed!

The action sequences are good and worth watching! All variants of action sequences are shot, martial, lethal weapons, car stunts and fights, traditional weapons and etc! So the full efforts were put on action sequences!

My hearty congrats to the KGF2 making team, they made a paisa wasool movie!

Title: No words can explain this film
Name: tejadhavala
actions:
0 out of 1 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Story: Story continues from KGF chapter 1 right where it ended. The plot is very clean and perfectly executed. But, a small part is misconnecting chapter 1 and 2. (Not mentioned due to spoiler) Music: There is nothing new about the music. As usual, it is extraordinary. Best viewed in Dolby atmos.

Screenplay& Direction: Even though there are many violent scenes and some unrealistic scenes, they contain a good emotion in them.

Probably this would be one of the best movies of the decade. This review is not based on heroic elevations. A story is said to be well executed only when we feel the complete essence in it. KGF series did it in a marvelous way. The movie hasn't been dramatized too much like other high budget commercial movies but it contained a deep felt emotion.

Title: One of the matured stories in a sequel ever?!!
Name: hsf-09231
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Plus: Showing actual (negative roles) of Andrews,Rajendra desai and Kamal was really a good story for beginning of KGF2.

Vanaram's continuation looked good too. He doesnt show any aggression even in chapter1 and is wise character was really good and perfectly suited .

Confusion cleared how Adheera is alive and it was as interesting as possible.

Dubai scene of Inayath and Rocky was intelligent from director . And also getting new weapons from him too . Perfectly synced scene these all are without any deviation in story. Dialogue scene when Rocky kills adheera henchmen and revealing of the weapons was really brilliant like a revenge.

Director displayed a creative side of Rocky too. The way he changed KGF infrastructure was shown at a perfect timing.

Screenplay and bgm syncing was unique and exciting during car chase scene when Reena was captured.

Twists of the movie are really unique. Happy to see modern age movies getting modern twists. Also corrupt politicians scene in front of PM was good beginning of rivalry.

A Unique location for a climax too. Also concluded kgf birth is rocky's birth . As well as kgf's end is rocky's end.

Every suspense characters from chapter 1 was logically continued in chapter 2.

Minus: Few scenes looked like old movie scenes like herione getting captured, Hero spending his life not as a citizen of country because a promise, Because of a promise of a kid ,U cannot live selfishly.

Rocky and Adheera's fight too looked bit routine. Chapter 1's last fight was masterpiece actually. Looked like adheera's character ended bit hurry without any planning attacks.

'INSPIRATION of Rocky' scenes deserve more hype than people 'SCARED of Adheera'. Few one man army Adheera scenes could have been better but director cared on duration so fine. Only one piece of location were Rocky's army and Adheera's fight so even that looked bit dissappointing as he could cover other locations of Modern KGF infrastructure.

There are some good and promising action sequences and some are just there for the sake of it. Also too much slo mo hampers the experience a bit. Overall good movie, one time watch.

Title: Outstanding performance
Name: amrnft
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text: After a long time waitness end. I have no word to describe for kgf. Its not only movie, its also emotional attachment. Ending was so sorrowful. Without it, it story lineup was amazing even no one can thought this upcoming story lineup when watching the movie.overall its a excellent movie with creating history.i think also this movie has separate fan base. Right through K. G. F: Chapter 2, I couldn't help but imagine what it must have been like for Prashant Neel to watch The Godfather for the first time. More than the whole film, I'd love to ask him someday about the impact its climax left him with as he watched it in what I imagine to be an old theatre, wherever he grew up. Like the iconic theatre scene in Cinema Paradiso, this moment must have been Prashanth's big life-altering moment, his metamorphosis where he not only discovered the magic of movies but also the concept of "mass" before it became a thing. Without sounding too dramatic, something must have clicked in him because there's no one here who thinks in intercuts like this man.

Don't miss this movie and please try and watch it in the theater.

Title: K.G.F Chapter 2, Masterpiece Of Indian Cinema.
Name: TorikulIslamYash
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
K. G. F : Chapter 2 review : Stunning Action Packed Drama.

My rating : 5/5 Performances : Yash is just outstanding with his terrific performance and unleashes his amazing screen presence throughout the movie. Yash continued from where he left in KGF 1. He carried himself with the same intensity and energy. He looked stylish, raw, and rugged and costumes suited his swag and mannerisms. He showed variations in his expressions turning brutal, ruthless, and menacing at one time and humane, and emotional at other times.

Srinidhi Shetty got a limited screen presence just like her role in the first part. However, she did full justice to her emoting well.

Sanjay Dutt looked powerful evoking fear as Adheera. Though the scenes featuring Yash and Sanjay Dutt are powerfully written, Sanjay Dutt's age showed up on the screen bringing down the intensity levels.

Raveena Tandon looked intense as a powerful politician who meant business while dealing with the anti-social elements.

Rao Ramesh as the CBI officer performed well and Prakash Raj did justice to her role.

Technical values : Prashant Neel drove everyone crazy with the hero elevation with mass elements in KGF1 which turned him into a national celebrity. All eyes are on him as to how he will come up in the KGF2. Prashant Neel dispelled all the doubts right from the start to the finish. He filled the entire film with heavy-duty action scenes which knocked the living daylights out of the viewers. The standout stunts included Yash's introduction, the action sequence before the interval and scenes that come up after the interval, and the heavy-duty climax. The stunt choreography is sensational. In order to elevate the heroism of Yash, he even showed Sanjay Dutt in an even more powerful manner. The way he ends the character of Rocky is also impressive. KGF 2 has so many factors that will relate to the masses as Neel takes us to the world of KGF and entertains you completely.

Music by Ravi Basrur is a backbone for the film as the re-recording breathes life to the film and all the elevation scenes on Rocky. Audio-wise, the film has all situational songs and is passable on screen.

Bhuvan Gowda's cinematography is top-notch as he presented the film superbly with his framing. The lighting setup created to showcase the dark shades in the movie is impressive.

Anbariv action choreography is Marvelous.

Dialogues are intense and production values are grand.

Highlights : Yash Excellent performance Elevations of Heroism Terrific Action Stunts Cinematography and Bgm Rich production values

Overall : Terrific Monster.

488 people found this helpful.

Title: A masterpiece of 3I's - Indelible, Incredible, Immense
Name: deekuben
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text: The much awaited sequel of KGF-1 is absolutely worth the wait (of 2 long years). The plot, flow, sequence, cinematography, action and everything was on point and subtle to the core. Rocky's role couldn't have been played by any other actor. He's the man who's made for it - The One and Only Masterpiece❤🔥! The eternal bond between Rocky and Reena, their purest form of love and her audacity are mind-boggling and heartwarming. His mother's name was finally revealed in this chapter. Her puissant relation with Rocky, her words had an immense effect on his life, right from the beginning. In fact, it was truly she who kept him going and combat all his ferocious and heinous combatants who had constantly been backstabbing him. The new roles introduced in this chapter have a big say and the climax made me speechless. But I'm glad about the closing theme giving us a surprise too. The hype created is absolutely worth it! Overall, it is certainly the #PrideOfKarnataka in every way. A fantastic present to the film industry by our Sandalwood. Prashant Neel sir has aced it✨💥! #ProudKannadathi & #ProudFanGirlOFYash❤💥

Title: Highly Overrated movie of the cinematic era
Name: Vinnuthna
actions:
2 out of 3 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text: After so much hype around the movie, I had watched it in a full packed theatre with great sound system and found myself closing my ears for the loud unnecessary background score. The movie had black out cuts during a car chase sequence and I was surprised, didn't understand a thing that why on earth anyone will edit a car chase in that manner lost my patience there. Throughout the movie I saw only elevations about the protagonist, people come praise him and leave one scene after other. I had a lot of expectation from the movie I really wanted this to be a well written one. But the story lacks emotions I felt no connection towards any character in the movie. The cinematographer had only close shots he didn't capture things well. The camera movements will cause eye ache during Adheera and Rocky fight one on one right after Reena's death. I can go on and on and on with the flaws in the movie but I am wondering how people have become blinded and support this kind of a movie which didn't have any field excelled at any level. Apart from Ananth Nag in the whole of KGF franchise I have not seen a single actor perform well. Yash was all about walking, throwing punch dialogues, I didn't see him act at all. He had a straight face. The villain was weak and for god sake the costume that rocky wears during his meet with prime minister of India is the costume of Allu Arjun in ala vaikuntapuramulo. Atleast they could have changed the Color. It's totally overrated and doesn't deserve what it is enjoying now. Hope Prashanth Neel will atleast give a good movie in his next.

Title: Awesome and Extraordinary
Name: nishirroy
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
"Hindi viewers, please don't regret later on when it'll be playing on TV and internet." This is what I mentioned in my review of KGF Chapter 1 after I watched it in cinemas. And today, as I witnessed the second chapter of this epic action saga in cinemas as well, I found myself blown away by the gripping plot, gorgeous visuals, stunning action sequences and most importantly, Yash's screen presence as Rocky. I can safely proceed to state that my expectations were not only met, but also surpassed by this fine sequel.

KGF Chapter 2 expands the scale and story introduced to us in part 1 and ends up raising the bar higher. The makers were definitely quite confident making it, and it shows in every single frame. From beautifully picturizing the KGF (Kolar Gold Fields) to explosively choreographing the action sequences to elevating Rocky's character at multiple occasions, they have shown they knew what the viewers wanted, and delivered the promise product without any hassle. I was also glad to see heavy cheering and whistling throughout almost the entire duration, and some credit goes to the dialogue writer as well. The music was also good and delivered without interfering with the storytelling (though one song in the second half wasn't really necessary).

The biggest plus point of the film is its screenplay. From re-introducing our favorite characters and introducing new ones to building up conflicts and backing them with explosive action, KGF Chapter 2 has all the ingredients of a proper mass entertainer. Not a single scene where it feels dragged or overdone. Sure, it does feel long at times, but it never gets boring, and with several twists and turns, the story remains intriguing till the end.

One thing I'd definitely want to tell the viewers is to not simply get up and walk away once the credits start rolling. There is a mid-credits scene, and it's an important one. Other than that, this film should be on your watchlist if you like period action films. In the end, I just feel glad and kind of proud seeing a film I liked in 2018 going on to receive much bigger hype and viewer turnout with its second part in 2022.
