Not just Yash but every characters played their part in this film disregarding the recurring or new faces in the film, especially Sanjay Dutt and Raveena Tandon whose character came with high expectations. Since I watched the film in tamil, hats off to dialogue writer for the memorable line. KGF 2 clearly one of the best Kannada movies. Its clearly a 10/10 film.

Title: Neither Past Nor Future...
Name: rockyverma
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Neither such a film was made, nor will it ever be made, (both parts) What should I say, if you talk about rating, then 1 point out of 10 is not there to reduce. The story and direction are so tight that you can't even blink and There are so many twists and turns in the story that you cannot imagine. Where the first part of the story ended, the second part takes it to the top. It is very difficult to take the story of any film to another part and above, but the director has done wonders.

When it came to acting, Yash broke all limits in playing the role of a gangster. His style of walking, sitting style, manner of talking, body language and his fight scenes have immortalized him in the role of gangster. Sanjay Dutt looked great in the character of the villain. Rest of the actors have done their respective roles. The cinematography is at the level of the best films in the world. The background music has brought life to every scene of the film. After years, such background music has been heard.

To be honest, I have no words to praise this film. Just this film forced me to write. Please do watch this movie.

text:
Its a wonderfully crafted fictional Mass entertainer. These words would explain the whole movie altogether.

There are two types of movie audience type and critic type. I'm a type of person who loves critic type of movie. But this one here clearly belongs audience and I loved it. I would like to appreciate the director for tricking me to forget abt logic and convinced me to enjoy the Movie irrespective of the flaws it has got. The narrative, Visuals, background score, writing of screenplay are the huge plus factor. He has given more importance to the writing. Screenplay is so engaging that you will have no time to think abt all those logics. Backed by constant BGM and Wonderful cinematography. (they never let their director down throughout movie) I understand if a critic gives less ratings, but you can't deny the fact that adrenaline rush your body went through while watching this movie. I know its not a perfect movie but I love the way it made me feel.

My first and last review in this lifetime... On 13 th I came from office ..watched IPL till 11:00.

Then started watching KGF -1 again.. I woke up and avoided looking at phone notification or browse through chrome and you tube as I didnt want any information regarding KGF-2 to reach me ... Next day I went for KGF-2.

I reached theater 30 mins before movie time ...These 30 min were very Hard...I wanted to break open the Entrance and wanted the movie to start at the earliest... Once the movie started I sat like I was giving an exam and nothing goes unnoticed on the screen... Concentarion level during movie was beyond imagination... And then came Rocking * Yash ...Once in your life time Movies like KGF are made..N througout your life you wont stop prasing the movie..That is KGF for me.... I missed the Post Credit scene so I will watch the movie again... Everything is excellent but after Games of Thrones ,KGF2 is the movie whose ending I hate and wished had a alternate ending as Rocky is Rocky .. Rocky can Be defeated by Rocky but he doest need to be defeated..He is the brand since and beyond 1951..

text:
Introduction - A powerful action packed movie with great acting and ultimate direction with clear crystal screenplay that focuses more on the raw action and narration of the story.

Acting and Casting - Yash's acting is at peaks, his rendition as Rocky has been proved in the 1st part itself, but in this chapter, he is more powerful and his swag is all you need to sit in a theatre for more than 2hrs experiencing this masterpiece, other cast also made justice to their roles, Sanjay as Adheera is very good, Raveena as Ramika is exceptional... Even though Prakash did a fair job as the new narrator, I still wanted Anantha nag sir as the narrator.. (his expressions and the hold on language pronounciation is far better)

Direction - This movie is an example of what a great and creative director Prashanth Neel is, he is a next generation director who can take Sandalwood into more of an Original PAN India hub, his excellency in directing this masterpiece and meeting the audience expectations after this much hype is unrealistic, he is a true creator.

Title: salaam rocky bhai ilaka tera bhai tu hai sabka bhai
Name: hridoyhossain-67156
actions:
1 out of 2 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Prashanth Neel returns as writer-director in KGF: Chapter 2, starring Yash as the gold-hearted gangster named Rocky. But first, a recap. The first chapter was a Deewar-like story of a young boy coming to Bombay and becoming a famous gangster. And then, he is sent to Karnataka, where he becomes even more famous: he becomes the messiah of the people of a secret mining town called KGF. We met Rocky's enemies like Shetty bhai in Bombay and Inayat Khalil in Dubai. We met the Indian Prime Minister, a woman whose face was never revealed, a woman who spoke of unleashing the army on Rocky while signing the death warrant of the man she considered "the biggest criminal in India."

But the film began with a television anchor played by Malavika Avinash. She listens to the KGF story as told by a senior journalist, played by Ananth Nag - and that is the same framing device Prashanth uses in the sequel as well. There's just one change. The narrator now is Prakash Raj, who plays the Ananth Nag character's son. I did not realise this while watching Chapter 1, but these conversations provide two things: a breather between the hectically paced events, and they are also a small bit of spoon-feeding for the audience, because the story is so deep and dense. No, let me correct that. The story is fairly uncomplicated. It's the narrative that's deep and dense. And we'll come to this later.

So what does Chapter Two have in store for Rocky? He still cares for his people, who worship him. But he wants them to mine for gold day and night. "The work should not stop," he says. Why? I'll just tell you that it has to do with a mother and a bedtime story she tells her son. Watch the first scene carefully, because this makes the closing images so powerful, so mythical. And between this beginning and this ending, we get a film that works at two levels. One, we get a huge action spectacle with very inventive set pieces, superbly shot by Bhuvan Gowda in dark tones that indicate that we are watching a darker sequel. And two, we get a style-filled masala movie, filled with whistle-worthy dialogue and scene after scene with twists and surprises for the audience.

In Chapter Two, Rocky has two new enemies: the Prime Minister, whose face is finally revealed and is played by Raveena Tandon, and a Viking-style brute named played by a terrific Sanjay Dutt. His entry scene on a burning bridge is one of the film's many epic highlights. In fact, every bit of this film is epic: Yash is epic and wonderfully larger-than-life, the dialogs are epic, Ravi Basrur's score is epic, and the action is epic, especially a car chase that keeps cutting to a black screen - but that is why I wished for some quiet, intimate moments between Rocky and his love interest, played by Srinidhi Shetty. We get an epic moment involving a helicopter, but we get no real idea about their relationship. Their great romance - if it is that - does not register at all. The second issue I had with the film was that the unmasking of the criminal mastermind was done too hastily.

But that apart, I had no complaints, and we can now talk about the narrative being deep and dense. In Chapter One, the combination of the fast cutting and slow motion created a stylised effect. We get some of that in Chapter Two as well, but Prashanth really pushes himself as a screenwriter and he also pushes his editor Ujwal Kulkarni - to the extent that every sequence plays like the legendary baptism stretch from the first Godfather. The visuals come at us very fast, but this is not just the usual quick cutting for an attention-deficit audience. This is carefully planned stylisation. Take the scene where the Raveena Tandon character is sworn in as Prime Minister. She reads out a line or two. And then we see her elsewhere, barking orders to sack the Home Minister. And then, we are back at the swearing-in ceremony. So there is a sense of playing with time. We see her in the present. We cut to her actions in the future. And we return to the present. And there is also a sense of playing with geography, because these two events are happening in two different locations.

This happens again and again. We have a no-confidence motion playing out in the Parliament. Simultaneously, we see a shootout. Rocky's wife has a bad dream. We move to a major action set piece, after which we return to the bad dream being narrated. This closing part of this narration is one of the few genuinely emotional moments in KGF: Chapter Two, along with the opening and closing imagery. But I didn't mind. The action and the masala flavour and the precision of the cuts are fantastic, and even if the story arc feels familiar, the denseness from the screenplay/editing makes it all seem new. Chapter Two improves on its predecessor: it is an epic times two.

Title: Blockbuster movie
Name: amarjangam
actions:
0 out of 1 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Best movie ever. In 2018, the blockbuster film KGF: Chapter 1 got released. Chapter 2 is the sequel to it. Vijay Kiragandur under the banner Hombale Films produces the film, directed by Prashanth Neel. Rockstars Yash, Srinidhi Shetty, Sanjay Dutt, and Raveena Tandon play the leads, while Prakash Raj, Malavika Avinash, Eswari Rao, and others provide supporting roles. Ravi Basrur composed the music, and Bhuvan Gowda handled the cinematography.

This installment of the series continues where the previous episode left off, with Rocky (Yash) as the leader of the KGF. Sanjay Dutt's character Adheera (Sanjay Dutt), who was believed to be dead, wants to take over the Gold Field. Rocky's allies from the first part have become his enemies, and they have also set their eyes on the throne. Ramika Sen, India's Prime Minister, has also declared Rocky the nation's most wanted criminal, and he is pursued by police. Whether Rocky maintains control over KGF and how he handles all these issues forms the plot of the film.

Title: No SPoiler of any sort. Just explaining my POV and possible mistakes.
Name: abhinavbhatnagar-16008
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
= No SPOILER, nothing. Only talking vaguely and giving my own opinion without any mirch masala. =

Let me be honest and tell you the problems. Lol --- First thing first, I enjoyed the movie. :D Now regarding problems and Over the top actions sequences and many egocentric decisions took place throughout the movie. Even the fact that life of a boy was decided by his mother,even though i won't argue, but still it felt a bit forced, but i know, it's not bad, kinda swayed the whole vibe for me as such things only take place when we think about villains = as in cruel treacherous villains, you know what i mean, right. As we always say, see his past is the reason for him being like that = But for Rocky i have a different feeling. He is more like a Antagonist but not a villain. It's like he has that vibe and the aura. He is like a person you wanna cheer for. So i was always thinking of him as MC. But now i think he is, Anti-Hero kinda being. Which is also my favourite genre btw.

--- Over the top actions could be a bit problematic, but they made it such a fast show of actions that it didn't really bother me. I get that from the first action scene, They are not trying to show me how well he fight.

They are just trying to set the tone and Let people's imagination run wild. Which IMO is a very good way to avoid OTT Action and at the same time having a similar impact, if nothing less.

--- So TBH not much of a problem anywhere.

Latest movies released like, RRR and BEAST.

ALL have problem with logic and actions were so illogical and let's say done with idiocy that i was kinda sad. But still, they all did one thing.

Giving us anime style fight scenes which you can enjoy with popcorn.

But still by the end i has this complaint in my mind. Like, why do this? Why your knee suddenly become allright that you can jump run, while just a min. Ago you can't even walk. How can broken knee just become allright, when soldiers specifically break them and didn't even gave you enough food and so on. SO it was so much, that finally i stopped my brain like It's ENOUGH, just stop. See this as you are seeing anime.

That's it.

OTT Action was much less in BEAST. But still, fighting with sword against soldiers who are fighting with AK-47, and so on. Was so stupid. That again i stopped my brain.

--- BUT in KGF Part 2 and even in part 1. They didn't give that much of a vibe of OTT ACtion going on. Which i loved. So i must say, I love their execution.

That's it.

Believe me, don't go for spoilers.

It's a great movie.

And they made it a fast movie, with blood pumping all around. Adrenaline and everything will just burst. Didn't get bored even for a sec.

I got to see Rocky bhai rise, his fall, even him being egoist and even changing toward this greedy and bad person, and also see how his people tried to bring him back to his previous Rocky, only to get things worse as his enemies attack. And he lost everything. And again he rises.

And as we all know, as a criminal rocky will eventually die. So no suspense in that. But still his journey was worth seeing.

Title: Ignore the movie a a fiction, imagine a movie where you have the balls to do what's you dreamt to do
Name: bneet-94391
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text: Loads of points in the movie are far fetched, loads of points are unrealistic. But imagine a person within the current society who doesn't give a sh**. He has goal though unrealistic, but the one was set up by his poor dying mother. This movie is about going through things to achieve these pre-destined Goliaths. The protagonist though unreal resembles a multiverse where a common pneumoniac kid destined to die, can grow up to be an inhuman but still bleed driven by a weakness( his humane side )which propels him to save some if not all. Loads of review online discuss about an over the top story, and I agree but my question to them is, why do you watch a movie? To forget your present, sometimes to remember the past, and sometimes to look for the future. Why can't there be a movie which talks about a resembling past (the ravina tondon performance did remind me of our own Iron Lady with all her shortcomings), a motivation less covid stricken present (where every one is confined to their own dark deep mines) and a selfless future (where your being is in commensalism with others). But just forget about all my bull sh**, watch the movie with a lovely sound track, on a Dolby sound, forget about the in-consequentialness of life, and remember the incapabilities of a father to create another Rocky (pun intended). You will get it when you watch the first half. Thanks.

Title: Once in a lifetime.
Name: srajanbshetty
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
KGF 2 Review: 'KGF:Chapter 1' set the tone for a slick gangster franchise-high on style and details. The first part was all about establishing the intentions and power of Raja Krishnappa Bairya aka Rocky Bhai. The second part has managed to create hype with its promotional content that gives a peek into the film. Does the film manage to match the build-up? It does and provides a better sequel and also has a big surprise for fans in the end, too.

The film begins with Vijayendra Ingalagi, the son of Anand Ingalagi, taking over as the narrator. Rocky has won over the people of KGF and he is now in the process of dreaming bigger and treading more dangerous paths. In this process, he encounters Adheera, who is inspired by the Vikings and evokes visceral fear, who wants KGF back. Simultaneously, he also has to encounter the righteous Prime Minister Ramika Sen, who also wants Rocky taken down.

Title: DONT THINK GO & WATCH
Name: ravirahul-92899
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
A prior thing i want to tell you before i write the review :

I am a college student and a hostelier , i was having some work in college but i left that in mid just to come back home and watch this movie . My friends in college says South Indian movies is all about illogical action scenes , no story , i told them before leaving , we have already proved you with Bahubali and many more . I reached home & asked my friends from hometown to come with me for the movie , they showed no interest & urged me to watch Zero , fortunately the only theatre in my hometown is showing KGF movie . So , i went to watch it alone & it's better to go alone than going with friends & getting their negative words for the movie while watching .

Analysis :

Only one line for the movie " Once in millennia" From the screenplay to the dialogues , the movie was commendable .

Before the interval

First half is full of action . The entry scene of Yash is amazing . Yash is doing role of character " Rocky" . The child actor has done his role at its best . In first half , lot of characters are introduced , you have to remember each and every actor as they have their role further in movie . The first half is story instigator with mind blowing action scenes . A small love story of Yash , and you know that any love story in South India is incomplete without action and same you will get here . In first half what i adored the most , the goosebump giving scene is the last scene before interval . I will not tell you what was that , just go and watch , and i hope you will love too .

...........................INTERVAL.......................

Was too much hungry , as i skipped my breakfast and lunch to come to home from college and without taking any rest , i ran to watch the movie , so bought some chips , cold drink . After interval , some favourite ads of my friends again came.

....................................................................

The second half

The real story began in the second part of movie. I personally like second half more than the first. The second half is what makes me the die hard fan of this movie. Again a lot of dialogues , that song showing mother love for her child Rocky completely caught attention. I am waiting for the movie songs to release especially that "Sultan" song. The tremendous work of Yash , his superb acting skills , all are beyond imagination. The terminating part of movie is unexpected and left curiousity in the minds of audience. I think the movie ended at a phenomenal stage, if you will not watch Chapter 2 that's also good , because the Chapter 1 despite leaving some suspense , can say it to be complete. But the story doesn't end here. The movie is elongated for the second chapter of the movie .

For screenplay : 4.5/5

For direction : 4/5

For dialogues : 4/5

Overall rating : 4/5

Review for the movie : A Simple line " Going to watch this movie again "

Yes , this movie put a smile on everyone's face and made everyone's day . As , I already said i love the CHAPTER 1 and second part perhaps not required but i also want this movie not to end here , eagerly waiting for the CHAPTER 2

You can hate South Indian movies , but you can't ignore the emerging Yash and KGF . Zero movie is not running well , it's expected that KGF will get more screens , of Zero also .

Edit : Some people are comparing Bahubali with KGF by saying KGF is not even near to position where Bahubali is but on being opposite to their reviews , I like KGF more than "Bahubali - The beginning " . It's truth that KGF will be criticized and people are criticizing it too. But what can we say, it's their views.

EDIT 2 : Watched the movie for the second time , still same curiosity.

Title: KGF Chapter 2 iReview (No Spoilers)
Name: ankit-33114-04236
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
IRate : 10 out of 10 ( not a BLOCKBUSTER, a new term penned by me, It's a "R-O-O-F-B-U-S-T-E-R")

Extraordinary scenes in Pune as well as even centre like Jamnagar, Surat, Ahemdabad where even 6am shows are Housefull (forget the madness in South)

Well well well, India has got a new R-O-O-F-B-U-S-T-E-R STAR and his name is YASH. KGF Chapter 1 surprised us all by showing the world of KGF in second half. But here in Chapter 2, director Prashant Neel immerses us completely in the world of KGF and from there ROCKY Bhai Yash takes over & rides the journey with many twists and turns with his awesome style, Hollywood level action, Bold charisma, whistle-worthy dialogues, his hard hitting punches & punchlines, delivering a KING-SIZED ENTERTAINMENT !!

KGF Chapter 2 is YASH's ticket to being a CROWD PULLING SUPERSTARDOM ! It's time to pack the bags for Bollywood's Khan's and Kumar's & Kapoor's because after Rajnikanth, this is YASH's time to be a legendary all-time favourite actor of pan-Indian audience for a long long time

Positives : Yash, Yash and Yash. Apart from that, Sanjay Dutt stands out as a menacing villain in a gruesome avtaar and ofcourse, the comeback of Raveena Tandon in a powerful act.

Stunning visuals, Heart-thumping background score, Fast paced screenplay and a suspenseful climax makes this a must watch

Nagetive : nothing.

Title: Outstanding movie
Name: yashch-05534
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Yash is just outstanding with his terrific performance and unleashes his amazing screen presence throughout the movie. Yash continued from where he left in KGF 1. He carried himself with the same intensity and energy. He looked stylish, raw, and rugged and costumes suited his swag and mannerisms. He showed variations in his expressions turning brutal, ruthless, and menacing at one time and humane, and emotional at other times.

Srinidhi Shetty got a limited screen presence just like her role in the first part. However, she did full justice to her emoting well.

Sanjay Dutt looked powerful evoking fear as Adheera. Though the scenes featuring Yash and Sanjay Dutt are powerfully written, Sanjay Dutt's age showed up on the screen bringing down the intensity levels.

Raveena Tandon looked intense as a powerful politician who meant business while dealing with the anti-social elements.

Rao Ramesh as the CBI officer performed well and Prakash Raj did justice to her role.

Title: What a movie
Name: yatendrasingh-67267
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Spoilers ahead...

There is something outlandish yet gorgeous about the K. G. F franchise that they no longer make such films. That they no longer imagine scenes propelled by absolute madness. After all, K. G. F films are written on steroids.

There is a moment in K. G. F: Chapter 2, where Rocky Bhai (a rocking Yash, bathed and cleansed in masculine orgy) takes a machine gun out to blow up a police station, in the garb of a "field test". With a cigarette hanging from his lip, he fires aimlessly to show his prowess as bullets zoom past the station and everything in between. Bullet casings drop to the ground and Bhai walks in slow-motion to light up his cigarette from the gun's nozzle with an equally electrifying background score by Ravi Basrur.

Title: Goosebumps overloaded
Name: techrisky
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text: The stars of KGF 2 are Yash and Prashanth Neel. The Kannada superstar's towering personality does full justice to the almost mythical character of Rocky Bhai. Very few stars would have made a role like Rocky Bhai believable and Yash owns it in every frame. Filmmaker Prashanth Neel ensures that the story proceeds at a brisk pace. Sanjay Dutt matches him in presence. Prakash Raj is nuanced as the narrator of the film. Raveena Tandon is impressive and you will wonder why she did not get such roles in her prime. From Rocky Bhai gaining sole control over Narachi to how he makes one quick escape to return stronger, it is one helluva ride. The visuals will linger in your memory for a long time. The team has shot at JSW sites, which gives KGF 2 the canvas of brown, grey and black. Ravi Basrur's scintillating BGM lifts up the sequences and you cannot help but stay transfixed to the screen. Another star of the film is cinematographer Bhuvan Gowda. The aesthetic of KGF 2 is a lot like Mad Max: Fury Road. Prashanth Neel who is part of the writing team ensures scenes loaded with dry humour and witty dialogues. With references to nepotism and secularism, KGF 2 taps into the modern milieu.

Title: India's Best Action Drama!!!
Name: anujbora-40485
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
There are extraordinary action movies that India has recently witnessed which includes Bahubali and RRR.

But....... The KGF franchise is on a whole other level!!! The movie KGF 2 completely lives up to the hype that's among the audience. It delivers a completely satisfying package of action, entertainment and drama. The Dialouges, the BGM, the cinematography; everything is just awesome. Some scenes can even be matched with hollywood action films.

And of course, the story. The story is so well written and the screenplay is so good that keeps people engaged throughout the movie. Another plus point of this movie which makes it better than other action movies are the realistic elements. The story feels real, the action scenes are practical, the set pieces are real and so are the Emotions that this movie conveys. And this is the specialty of KGF.

Hats off to the director - Prasanth Neel. I had never thought that such a mass movie could be made in India. Kudos to the entire kgf team.

This will be my most fav action movie forever coz I don't really think that any movie can replace the hype that KGF has created.

Title: No words...its Fire 🔥
Name: wvyissdf
actions:
0 out of 1 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Hats off the entire crew for giving such a powerful movie...

Craze + content + brand + emotion + records + goosebumps = KGF chapter 2 🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥

KGF franchise is itself is another pride of Indian Cinema. KGF let's us to witness never before elevations, swag and many adreline moments. The team has put a lot of effort to make this amazing movie. The audience will love this movie and cheerish ..."KGF will recreate the history".

The performance of Yash as Rocky bhai is absolutely Killer. His style, swag, passion, dialog delivery is terrific. He has set the screen on fire with his insane screen presence. Hats off to his commitment towards KGF for 8 years. Srinidhi shetty has done her job she has got more screen time in chapter 2. Sanjay dutt was looking evil in his role and has done justice for his role, Raveena Tandon did a brilliant job. Prakash Rai, Malaika and others were good in their role.

Prashath Neel had done mindblowing job he will be remembered as one of the India's biggest Director in the history of Indian Cinema. Brilliant fiery Screenplay, Excellent Direction. We are used to witness elevations in between story but we feel that story is in between elevations. Pure goosebumps stuff throughout the movie. Hats off to neel for pulling up this Marvel. Cinematographer Bhvan has done amazing job each and every frame looks very Rich and has solid impact on us. Ravi Basruru has taken the Cinema to the another level his music and bgm gives goosebumps every then and now. All the other technicians did fantastic job.

0 out of 1 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
The multiverse .....the rocky ......the KGF.

Chapter 2 follows the story of Rocky (Yash), an orphan rising from poverty to become the king of a gold mine. The first film came out in 2018. In addition to Yash, the sequel features Bollywood actor Raveena Tandon and marks Sanjay Dutt's debut in Kannada films. KGF: Chapter 2 also stars Prakash Raj, Malavika Avinash, and Srinidhi Shetty, among others.

About starring in the film, Srinidhi told PTI in an interview. "I couldn't believe I had received the opportunity. I was going for the homecoming ceremony (after the international pageant) and this was the first project I got. I went for the meeting, and Prashanth narrated the story and my character. Back then it was not 'KGF' part one and two," she added.

Title: The Best Sequel Ever
Name: aupadhyay887
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text:
Ohhh my god! What a movie that was. Pure entertaining mass action masala movie. I just loved the direction of Prashant Neel Sir. Yes ofcourse there are few illogical moments but that's the beauty of his direction. His direction will keep you away from those moments. Your attention will only be on that scene. The build up behind those scenes are amazing. Brilliant cinematography. Kudos to the cinematographer 👏👏👏👏. Let me now talk about the performances of every actor. OMG!! Yash, Yash and Yash amazing performance. Apart from that, Sanjay Dutt stands out as a menacing villain in a gruesome avtaar and ofcourse, the comeback of Raveena Tandon in a short but powerful act. Brutal action, top notch performances, Stunning visuals, Heart-thumping background score and the climax makes this a must watch.

Completely mind blowing movie a total power packed package. And the climax makes this a must watch.

Long story short KGF 2 is a must must action thriller !! Don't miss it!!

                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text: Compared to KGF Chapter 1 the Chapter 2 is not what I expected. The movie's story and narration takes a big chunk of excitement and it upsets me a lot. Half time into the movie, the movie felt just "Boring". There is fantastic background music and hero elevations through the screen time. But the lack of coherence In the story telling combined with some very fast paced editing make the whole thing feel uninspired and gore. It feels that the movie could have done much better story-wise. Overall, it's watchable, but not memorable.

text: The film showcases the life and journey of Rocky after he kills Garuda in Kolar gold fields. The film is beautifully shot and every scene is a treat to watch. Director and writer Prasanth Neel's vision is superb and he presented the vision in such a manner that it is wholesome of entertainment along with every minute detail which is awesome as a viewer and movie fan ... The film is shot on a very large scale as it's main character Rocky is larger than life and the film leaves no point prooving that .. although it's a fiction but spending almost 2:45 min in theatre every single person is in awe of the protagonist Rocky as well as other characters ... And finally rocking star Yash.. needless to say it's one of the strongest and lived character we all have seen in past few years in Indian cinema..... No Bollywood , no tollywood , no Kollywood ... Kgf chapter 2 and even 1 is Indian cinema which is roaring in all over the globe and making us Indians proud bcoz the magic this film has created within a 100 crore rupees budget it's a treat to watch.

Title: A Genre redefined.
Name: arjunvasudeva
actions:
0 out of 0 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink
text: There are a couple of things to keep in mind while watching this movie. Firstly, this genre of movie is not meant to please everyone. Some might feel senseless action and flying cars which do not obey the laws of physics. This movie is not for the hypercritical. This movie has a very unique factor which is the strength of this film, which is the entertainment factor. Go to this movie leaving your physics book at home to watch fantastic visuals and very quirky conflict-ions which you might not get to see in any other genre. The strong points of this movie are Cinematography, BGM, and over the top dialogues. It is hyper dramatic and loud. But that is the style of this movie . It is more like a graphic novel made with real life action setting. Definitely go and watch this movie with your gang to have a ball , chill out, experience the bloody, cool and over the top action film like you enjoy a DWAYNE JOHNSON film. Don't try to make sense of it's quirkiness. That is the point of the movie .

text: The screenplay, cuts and sound effects deserves a standing ovation. There are illogical moments but that don't take away you, because the Director keeps you invested in the 'state of disbelief' and that is the success of this movie. text:
Uff! The movie started with goosebumps and ended with goosebumps 😉.

The story progresses at a brisk pace in a racy tale of Rocky's journey to the top. The film, like the first part, presents a dark, dreary world that is stylishly shot. While the first part took time to prove who the protagonist was and included more time to establish the same, this second part moves quicker and one gets to meet more characters. The conflicts and battles are more interesting this time.

First Time an India Movie will sweep all the Awards, Finally we got a movie where every artist is recognized and appreciated for their hardwork and artwork. So glad to see these guys to build their own legacy.
